title: Ticket #7409: Daisy-chained HTCondor-CE Gridmanager Assertion ERROR
description:
Our friends at PIC and CIEMAT are having issues with their daisy-chained HTCondor-CE setup (the PIC HTCondor-CE/HTCondor setup submits some jobs to the CIEMAT HTCondor-CE/HTCondor setup via Condor-G), where an instance of the job is being removed somewhere along the chain, causing an assertion error:

  ERROR "Assertion ERROR on (gahp != __null || gmState == 14 || gmState == 12)" at line 391 in file /slots/10/dir_3391896/userdir/.tmpa8mXuo/BUILD/condor-8.8.1/src/condor_gridmanager/condorjob.cpp

Unfortunately, this kills the Gridmanager meaning that all jobs after the first problematic one don't get status updates.
remarks:
2019-Dec-09 16:17:20 by jfrey:
This is a bug in the gridmanager that affects Condor-C (a.k.a. grid-type condor) jobs. It can trigger when the job's proxy file disappears and the job lease expires. If the gridmanager subsequently resumes managing the job (say after the job is held and released, or the gridmanager restarts), this ASSERT() is hit.

Most of the code in the CondorJob class assumes it has a valid GahpClient object. The ASSERT() in question enforces this. If the job's proxy file is missing, then we can't create the appropriate GahpClient object. There's a narrow code path to put the job on hold in this situation, which avoids the ASSERT(). The lease expiration handler pushes the CondorJob object out of this narrow code path.

2019-Dec-12 13:23:56 by tlmiller:
Code Review

Looks good.
